timeline.message: Set Up Routing, Component and Modules
Provided correct page title and started i18 section
Simple Dummy Table Implementation and DTO Idea
Fixed case when no result exists
Added achieved score to table and csv
Took out exam average score calculation for the moment

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer returning an Optional instead of null.

Changed Code to Usage of Optional

timeline.bodyText: I don't think you need "exerciseGroups.exercises.studentParticipations.submissions" here.
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: The DB query is already quite extensive, in particular if we have >1000 students and 6-10 exercises, so we should try to avoid unnecessary data here
replies.author: krusche

timeline.author: krusche

timeline.message: Written the mother of all tests

timeline.bodyText: Why do we return "" instead of null if no registrationNumber is present?
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: yes, we should return null, trim() is also not necessary
replies.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: Why not initialize studentResult.overallPointsAchieved with 0. Then you don't need the conditional.
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: scores.maxPoints is equalTo exam.maxPoints. The assumption here is, that the exam.maxPoints = sum(all exercise.maxPoints) but at the moment the scores of the exercises are set independently.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: I think we should take exam.maxPoints. The instructor needs to make sure that this is set correctly
replies.author: krusche

timeline.author: kloessst
kloessst
kloessst

timeline.bodyText: Should we use @JsonInclude(JsonInclude.Include.NON_EMPTY) like with the other entities. I'm not sure what the client expects.
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: I really like how you have used DTOs here! I would suggest to stick to our implicit filename convention (e.g. (student-dto.model.ts)
timeline.author: sascha11110

timeline.bodyText:
I think this routes wouldn't be lazy loaded. Have a look at exam-management.route.ts, especially examManagementState routes (also see Angular's documentation).
I would also suggest to stick to our naming convention --> exam-scores.route.ts
timeline.author: sascha11110

replies.bodyText: I've overseen RouterModule.forChild(routes). So lazy loading should be fine but I would still suggest to change the filename.
replies.author: sascha11110

replies.bodyText: I think Stefan intended to send only necessary data. This is one reason why he used DTOs here.

replies.bodyText:
I just looked it up, this is used to display the title of the exercise in the html.
There is no other usage, so I think it should be fine!
